is it's nothing more than a simple framework for essentially handling those situations where which
are largely predictable but partly unpredictable so it essentially is a
formalism for being able to handle the unpredictability of certain scenarios
and that essentially is what characterizes at almost driving as well you never have any situation where

would say learn how to deal with that lack of predictability is a good model
to achieve that that is another concept that is called the cue table a cue table

simple table most of the time the states might be many more than this it could be as many as twenty or thirty or fifty

there are many many models in reinforcement learning one pretty
popular model is called the actor critic model and in this model what you essentially have is a system and usually
what happens is that the system and the actor or the agent will interact very
directly though so the system will often be called the environment and the actor will typically be called the agent and
that is essentially a reward from the from the system that goes or from the environment that goes directly to the
agent or actor the actor knows how to deal with that world the actor critic
model is a little different and the reason it's different is because it is possible for the actor or the agent to
be sometimes biased they do not necessarily always make the best decisions based on the rewards that they
get they may not like the rewards and they may still keep doing the same thing so the purpose of the critic and this
again is a mathematical formalism for this but at the entry to level the critic essentially gets the reward from
the from the environment the critic essentially is able to evaluate the
reward and judge if it is something that the actor should be doing differently or
not and then it will have a certain it will essentially instruct the actor to
do certain things differently but the whole objective here is that a critic is impartial whereas the actor is a
partial entity and as a mathematical formulation of around us about essentially RL models that follow the
actor critic formalism usually tend to converge very very fast and they end up with you end up with better RL models as
a result deep Q networks are basically
there for fundamentally addressing
situations where you may not have a finite set of states and typically
almost about ninety and ninety five personal situations fall in that category so almost all of RL or most of
RL typically would use a deep Q network in a deep Q Network the whole idea is
basically to go from a few states which
